entry.title: Treffen Sie die Experten des SAP Kundensupports auf den DSAG-Technologietagen 2025 in Wiesbaden
entry.content:
Treffen Sie die Experten des SAP Kundensupports auf den DSAG-Technologietagen 2025 in Wiesbaden

Vom 2. bis 3. April 2025 ist es wieder soweit â€“ die DSAG-Technologietage Ã¶ffnen ihre TÃ¼ren in Wiesbaden, und der SAP-Kundensupport ist vor Ort mit spannenden Inhalten und innovativen AnsÃ¤tzen vertreten! Besuchen Sie den SAP-Stand und lernen Sie die Experten des SAP Kundensupports persÃ¶nlich kennen.

Was erwartet Sie am SAP-Stand?

Unsere Experten decken eine Vielzahl an Themen ab, die fÃ¼r die Transformation und den Betrieb Ihrer SAP-LÃ¶sungen relevant sind:

  • Integrated Toolchain â€“ Umstellung auf die Cloud oder auf eine Clean Core Strategie mit Hilfe von SAP Cloud ALM, SAP Signavio, LeanIX
  • SAP Cloud ALM â€“ Optimieren Sie Ihre Cloud-Reise mit proaktiver Ãœberwachung und ProzessunterstÃ¼tzung
  • SAP Business Transformation Center & Transformation Tools â€“ Tools zur nahtlosen Datenmigration und Systemtransformation
  • AI & Agentic AI im Kundensupport â€“ KI-getriebene Innovationen, die Support-Prozesse revolutionieren
  • SAP for Me & Early Watch Services â€“ Optimieren Sie Ihren Systembetrieb und bleiben Sie proaktiv informiert
  • Black Friday Cyber Monday / Holiday Season Readiness Program â€“ Innovative Tools wie Smart Resolve und Cure 360 zur Vorbereitung auf die umsatzstÃ¤rksten Verkaufsevents des Jahres

Nutzen Sie die Gelegenheit, um mit den SAP-Experten ins GesprÃ¤ch zu kommen, und erfahren Sie, wie der SAP-Kundensupport als Frontrunner im Einsatz von KÃ¼nstlicher Intelligenz (KI), Agentic AI und LLMs (Large Language Models) vorangeht. Erhalten Sie Einblicke in den praktischen Einsatz dieser Technologien und nehmen Sie wertvolle AnsÃ¤tze fÃ¼r Ihr Unternehmen mit.

Verpassen Sie nicht diese spannenden Sessions!

In Ihrem Messefahrplan sollten diese beiden Sessions auf keinen Fall fehlen:

Session 1: SAP TED Talk
ğŸ—“2. April, 17:15â€“18:00 Uhr Sichern Sie Ihre Reise in die Cloud mit SAP Cloud ALM
Planen Sie den Umstieg auf die Cloud? SAP Cloud ALM bietet Ihnen eine klare Roadmap und umfassende UnterstÃ¼tzung fÃ¼r Ihre Cloud-Reise. Diese LÃ¶sung minimiert Risiken und stellt einen nahtlosen Betriebsablauf sicher. Entdecken Sie durch praxisnahe Demonstrationen die neuesten Funktionen und erhalten Sie entscheidende Einblicke, um Ihre Cloud-Strategie effektiv zu optimieren. Mit SAP Cloud ALM erhalten Sie nicht nur technische UnterstÃ¼tzung, sondern auch klare Anleitungen fÃ¼r das Projektmanagement, um Ihren Unternehmenserfolg in der digitalen Transformation zu sichern.

Sprecher: SÃ¶ren Ruder, SVP, Chief Product Officer (CPO) and Head of Customer Experience & Solutions (CXS)

Session 2: SAP Expert Session (freie Q&A)
ğŸ—“3. April, 10:55â€“11:15 Uhr Autonomes Application Lifecycle Management
Die Rolle der KÃ¼nstlichen Intelligenz (KI), insbesondere der Agentischen KI, beim Transformieren des Application Lifecycle Managements (ALM) steht im Zentrum dieser PrÃ¤sentation. Erfahren Sie, wie KI-Technologien nicht nur Aufgaben automatisieren, sondern auch proaktiv Entscheidungen treffen, um die Effizienz und LeistungsfÃ¤higkeit Ihrer IT-Systeme zu steigern. Erleben Sie, wie autonomes ALM herkÃ¶mmliche VerwaltungsansÃ¤tze revolutioniert und den Weg fÃ¼r innovative, zukunftsweisende Prozessgestaltung ebnet.

Sprecher: SÃ¶ren Ruder, SVP, Chief Product Officer (CPO) and Head of Customer Experience & Solutions (CXS)

Beachten Sie bitte auch folgende Sessions:

2. April 2025

  • 13:00 Uhr - V005: SAP ALM Ãœberblick und Ausblick
  • 13:00 Uhr - V021: SAP EarlyWatch Alert: kritische Alerts Ihrer hybriden SAP-Landschaft zentral zusammengefasst - auch nach dem Wartungsende des SAP Solution Managers
  • 14:15 Uhr - V006: SAP Cloud ALM im Betrieb
  • 14:15 Uhr - V022: KI Szenarien im SAP Services & Support / Mit der AI Innovation Plattform den Business Value von SAP Services & Support steigern
  • 16:00 - V007: SAP Cloud ALM fÃ¼r Implementierung
  • 17:15 - V008: SAP Maintenance Strategy - End of Mainstream Maintenance SAP Solution Manager 7.2. - what you need to know now

3. April 2025

  • 10:30 Uhr - V057: Transition nach SAP Cloud ALM
  • 14:00 Uhr - V059: SAP Cloud ALM - Change & Deployment Management
  • 15:15 Uhr - V060: SAP Cloud ALM im Kontext Rise und AI 

Treffen Sie uns auch in den DSAG-Arbeitskreisen

Unsere Experten sind darÃ¼ber hinaus in den DSAG-Arbeitskreisen aktiv. Ein Blick in die Agenda lohnt sich â€“ vielleicht sehen wir uns dort!

Wir freuen uns auf den persÃ¶nlichen Austausch mit Ihnen in Wiesbaden. Lassen Sie uns gemeinsam Ã¼ber Ihre individuellen Herausforderungen sprechen und wie wir Sie mit modernen Tools, KI-Innovationen und bewÃ¤hrten Services auf Ihrer Reise zur Cloud und darÃ¼ber hinaus begleiten kÃ¶nnen.

Mehr Informationen und die vollstÃ¤ndige Agenda finden Sie auf der offiziellen Website der DSAG-Technologietage.

entry.title: Unlock the Power of SAP Universal ID: Simplify Your Digital Identity
entry.content:
First letâ€™s understand what SAP Universal ID is and what are the benefits of having one. 



Are you finding it challenging to manage numerous SAP accounts and passwords? Imagine having a single, unified account that links all your existing company associations, allowing you to switch between them effortlessly. That's where SAP Universal ID comes in! 

 

SAP Universal ID will be your personal SAP identity, the S-user ID is a Business SAP identity given by company administrators and can be utilized as an entitlement under the SAP Universal ID.


With SAP Universal ID, you can: 
 

  • Take control of your experience:â€¯Own and manage your personal SAP identity. 

 

  • Keep your account for life:â€¯Use it wherever you go, regardless of where you work. 

 

  • Use one login for all your accounts:â€¯Manage one account and password by linking all your existing company accounts (S-user IDs) in one universal account.â€¯ 


Once your account is set up, you can access theâ€¯SAP Universal ID Account Manager,â€¯which is your single-entry point to view, update, and manage your personal information, account security settings, and associations to companies. 

 
Here is a link to the video https://www.sap.com/assetdetail/2023/03/d0944279-6a7e-0010-bca6-c68f7e60039b.html and see how simple it is to create SAP Universal ID. 

 

SAP Universal ID will also preserve users' community reputations and learning certificates. This ensures the continuity of personal achievements across SAP platforms and services, reinforcing its pivotal role in user identity management within the SAP ecosystem. 

Benefits of having SAP Universal ID: 

  • SAP Universal ID allows you to combine all your existing and future S/P-user accounts under a single password, eliminating the need to keep track of all your S/P-user IDs. 
  • SAP Universal ID includes all your existing and future S/P-user identities. In theâ€¯SAP Universal ID Account Manager, you can manage all your user identities, personal data, security, and privacy settings 
  • Your SAP Universal ID is personal and belongs to you throughout your working life. You can use it to preserve your learning certificates and community reputation even when you change job. 
  • In general, it is not mandatory to create SAP Universal ID. However, if you want to preserve your community reputations and learning certificates, you will need to have an SAP Universal ID. 

Now it has been made mandate to add a secondary email ID under SAP Universal ID to ensure that your SAP Universal ID is compliant. 

 
Here is the link to add recovery email to your SAP Universal ID - https://learninghub.sap.com/help-center/faq/uidlink and https://learning.sap.com/how-to-assign-a-second-email-account 

 

If you are ever in doubt, please contact the Customer Interaction Center team CIC 

If you wish to unlink a secondary email ID from your primary SAP Universal ID or delete your SAP Universal ID entirely, you can contact CIC via email with the necessary details. A confirmation email, including all your linked email IDs, is required to proceed. This ensures a written record of your request and helps prevent any discrepancies. 
 

Steps to Unlink a Secondary Email ID: 

  • UID (email ID created via account.sap.com) : 
  • E-mail, or S/P IDs to be unlinked: 
  • Reason: 
  • Proof of ownership (The request must be sent from the UID email address, or alternatively from an email account linked to it): 
  • Please confirm if you have any certifications linked to your SAP Universal ID.

If your inquiry pertains to SAP certifications and exams, pleaseâ€¯contact our SAP Training/Certification team by following the below steps: 

 

  • You would first need to login to https://learning.sap.com
    • Scroll towards the bottom and click on Get Support under learning support. 
    • Again, scroll down towards the bottom look for Create a new case or check the status of an existing one 
    • Once done, you will be asked to enter the details and that should be sent to the training team, additionally you can check the details of yours existing training cases.

      Thanks for reading!â€¯â€¯â€¯ 
      â€¯â€¯ 
      We would love to hear from you, let us know what you think?â€¯

      â€¯If you have any questions,â€¯pleaseâ€¯feel free toâ€¯askâ€¯us in the Q&Aâ€¯All Questions in Customer Experience | SAP Communityâ€¯andâ€¯All Questions in Support Services | SAP Communityâ€¯â€¯â€¯ 

      â€¯Read more #Customer Interaction Centreâ€¯blogpostsâ€¯Here!â€¯â€¯â€¯

entry.title: SAP Signavio : How to Get Support
entry.content:
SAP Signavio Support:

If you encounter any challenges while using SAP Signavio, there are multiple support channels available to assist you. Below is a guide on how to seek assistance.

  1. For product related questions open a ticket in SAP for Me.

The SAP for Me portal provides access to task-driven support resources and applications. Within the Services and Support section, you will find multiple options to connect with SAP Signavio service experts. You can explore the knowledge base for existing solutions or use the Get Support tile to create a case for further assistance.

 

Important Note:

To access support, you must have a valid contract with SAP active maintenance. Additionally, an S-User ID with the necessary authorizations is required to submit a support case for SAP Signavio.

For more details on obtaining an S-User ID, refer to the following resources:

  1. 3315692 - How can I create new S-User or authorizations for SAP Signavio products in SAP For Me? - SAP for Me

  2. SAP Support Portal

  3. SAP Note 1271482

    For comprehensive guidance, please refer to the official help documentation:
    ğŸ‘‰SAP Signavio Support | SAP Help Portal

2. For personalized guidance or Assistance for SAP Enterprise Support Academy and value maps

Once you've signed up you can directly access our learning platform via:

SAP Enterprise Support Academy     
SAP Signavio Value Map

If you require assistance with on how to utilize SAP Signavio onboarding and adoption offerings, use the form provided to raise a call back request or you can also write to  contact us via email.

3. Academic support for SAP Signavio


For assistance, reach out to the SAP Signavio support team through the Contact Information page.

 

4. For questions on SAP for Me navigation, S-user ID and Universal ID contact the Customer Interaction Center. 


5. For non-technical questions contact your Account Executive or Customer Success Partner. 

Important Notes-

SAP Signavio Support | SAP Help Portal

SAP Signavio Onboarding Resource Center


General SAP notesï¼š

SAP Signavio Support | SAP Help Portal

Contact Information | Signavio


We hope you found this useful. Please note that theâ€¯Customer Interaction Centerâ€¯is always happy to guide you on any of the mentioned processes and assist you with any queries you may have. 

If you have any questions, please post in the Q&A (Question & Answer) section here:â€¯All Questions in Customer Experience | SAP Communityâ€¯andâ€¯All Questions in Support Services | SAP Community 

Read more #Customer Interaction Centre blogposts Here!

entry.title: How to contact Fieldglass Support
entry.content:
To get support for SAP Fieldglass, access â€¯SAP Fieldglass Help Center  here â€¯.  

The next step is to select one of the four roles from  Worker, Supplier, Buyer, or PMO.  

From here follow the below steps  

  1. Go toâ€¯Fieldglass Help Centerâ€¯ 
  2. Choose a role that describes them 

 3. Choose a role that describes them 

 4. Locate the tab â€˜Contact Usâ€™ 

 5. Enter search terms related to their query 

 6. Check the results for recommended solutions & answers 

 7. Click the option â€œSomething Elseâ€ if they canâ€™t find what they are looking for 

 

 

 8. Click â€œCreate a Caseâ€ 

 9. Fill in the case details 

 10. Click to submit the case 

Choose a support channel to submit the case. The channel can be either email or phone.  

Please be advised that phone support is available in English only. 

Following submission, case visibility and case update is available through the contact us tab.  

You will be able to see your opened cases provide an update or request a follow up by email or phone. Follow ups that you have provided through the Fieldglass Help Center would be listed under the "Follow Up" Tab. 

 

If still unsure of the process, please see https://video.sap.com/media/t/1_oi1ryvmu. This is a step by step that will assist (How-to video (40sec, no audio)â€¯. 

 S-User ID? 

SAP Fieldglass - For technical assistance 

With a valid S-user ID with the correct authorizations assigned, please create a case via theâ€¯SAP for Me portal. 

If you do not have an S-user ID and you are a Worker, Supplier, Buyer, or a PMO user you can receive technical assistance via theâ€¯Fieldglass Help Centerâ€¯as mentioned above. 

  • 1296527 -â€¯How to create a support case for SAP Support - SAP for Me 
  • 3367715 - Changes to SAP Fieldglass phone and email support channels 

Furthermore, please find below this link which you may find helpful: 

Business End User SAP Fieldglass 

Thanks for reading!

entry.title: Informationen und Updates zu SAP Preferred Success 2025
entry.content:
NEWS 2025 - Informationen und Updates zu SAP Preferred Success

"Digital Adoption" ist in aller Munde â€“ aber was bedeutet das konkret fÃ¼r Unternehmen? Mein Kollege Thomas Jenewein hat in seinem aufschlussreichen Blogbeitrag die verschiedenen Aspekte und betroffenen Bereiche dieses Konzepts anschaulich dargelegt.

Ein Kernaspekt der digitalen Adoption ist die AnpassungsfÃ¤higkeit an neue technologische MÃ¶glichkeiten. Anders ausgedrÃ¼ckt: Es geht darum, wie Unternehmen neue digitale Werkzeuge und Technologien effektiv nutzen und in ihren Arbeitsalltag integrieren. Diese Herausforderung stellt viele Organisationen vor komplexe Aufgaben â€“ und genau hier setzt SAP Preferred Success an.

Wie genau unterstÃ¼tzt SAP Preferred Success Unternehmen bei ihrer digitalen Transformation?

SAP Preferred Success ist weit mehr als nur ein Supportmodell â€“ es ist ein umfassender Begleiter fÃ¼r Unternehmen auf ihrer Cloud-Reise mit SAP-LÃ¶sungen. Der Service bietet nicht nur UnterstÃ¼tzung bei der initialen Implementierung, sondern steigert langfristig die ProduktivitÃ¤t und Effizienz von Organisationen in der Cloud.

Im Mittelpunkt steht ein dedizierter Customer Success Manager, der in regelmÃ¤ÃŸigen Abstimmungsmeetings einen maÃŸgeschneiderten Erfolgsplan erstellt und dessen Umsetzung begleitet.

Dieser Plan bedient sich aus einem groÃŸen Katalog verschiedener Services, die auf die spezifischen BedÃ¼rfnisse des jeweiligen Unternehmens zugeschnitten werden. Dazu gehÃ¶ren Solution Launch Checks und Success Checks, die eine optimale Konfiguration der SAP-LÃ¶sungen sicherstellen und Verbesserungspotenziale aufdecken.

Ein Highlight ist die detaillierte Release-Begleitung, die tiefe Einblicke in neue Software-Versionen und deren Auswirkungen bietet. Dies ermÃ¶glicht eine proaktive Planung und erleichtert die Anpassung an neue FunktionalitÃ¤ten.

Zur FÃ¶rderung der kontinuierlichen Weiterbildung beinhaltet das Programm fÃ¼nf Lizenzen fÃ¼r den SAP Learning Hub. Diese ermÃ¶glichen den Zugang zu gezielten Schulungsprogrammen, die auf die spezifischen Anforderungen des Unternehmens abgestimmt sind.

SAP Preferred Success bietet zudem erweiterten Support mit verbesserten Service Level Agreements. Dies gewÃ¤hrleistet schnellere Reaktionszeiten und effizientere ProblemlÃ¶sungen. Bei komplexen Herausforderungen stehen dem Unternehmen Fachexperten mit fundiertem Know-how zur Seite.

Insgesamt zielt SAP Preferred Success darauf ab, Unternehmen die notwendigen Werkzeuge, das erforderliche Wissen und die benÃ¶tigte UnterstÃ¼tzung zu bieten, um ihre digitale Transformation erfolgreich zu gestalten und den maximalen Nutzen aus ihren SAP-LÃ¶sungen zu ziehen.

Eine unabhÃ¤ngige Studie von Forrester Consulting hat die Vorteile von SAP Preferred Success untersucht und quantifiziert. Die Ergebnisse zeigen, dass Unternehmen, die das Programm nutzen, erhebliche Verbesserungen erzielen konnten. Dazu gehÃ¶ren eine gesteigerte ProduktivitÃ¤t, reduzierte Systemausfallzeiten und beschleunigte EinfÃ¼hrung und Updates. Die Erkenntnisse aus der Studie unterstreichen den Wertbeitrag von SAP Preferred Success fÃ¼r Unternehmen, die ihre SAP-Investitionen optimal nutzen mÃ¶chten.

Kontinuierliche Weiterentwicklung: Neuerungen bei SAP Preferred Success

SAP Preferred Success entwickelt sich stetig weiter, um mit den sich wandelnden Anforderungen der Kunden und den Fortschritten in der SAP-Technologie Schritt zu halten. In den vergangenen Jahren wurde das Programm nicht nur fÃ¼r eine breitere Palette von SAP-LÃ¶sungen ausgerollt, sondern auch um innovative Services erweitert.

Eine Ãœbersicht der SAP-LÃ¶sungen, fÃ¼r die SAP Preferred Success verfÃ¼gbar ist, einschlieÃŸlich detaillierter Informationen zu jeder LÃ¶sung, findet sich hier.

SAP hat mit der EinfÃ¼hrung der "Expanded Edition" von Preferred Success einen bedeutenden Schritt nach vorn gemacht. Diese erweiterte Version richtet sich an Unternehmen, die vor komplexeren Herausforderungen stehen oder eine intensivere Betreuung bei der Nutzung ihrer SAP-LÃ¶sungen wÃ¼nschen.

Zusammengefasst bieten die Expanded Editions von SAP Preferred Success eine Reihe von Vorteilen:

  • Tiefgreifenderes Expertenwissen durch einen erweiterten Zugang zu Fachleuten, die ihr umfangreiches SAP Know-How einbringen.
  • ZusÃ¤tzliche UnterstÃ¼tzung: Neben dem Customer Success Manager steht ein Produktspezialist zur VerfÃ¼gung, der detaillierte Einblicke bietet.
  • Verbesserte Supportleistungen, um noch schneller und effektiver auf Kundenanfragen reagieren zu kÃ¶nnen.

Auch zu den Expanded Editions von SAP Preferred Success gibt es eine unabhÃ¤ngige Forrester-Studie, die deren Vorteile fÃ¼r Unternehmen analysiert und bewertet hat. Laut dieser Studie erzielten Unternehmen eine signifikante Effizienzsteigerung. Dies Ã¤uÃŸerte sich vor allem in einem schnelleren Zugang zu SAP-Expertise, einer deutlichen Reduzierung externer Partnerkosten sowie erheblichen Zeitersparnissen bei der Verwaltung von Anpassungen. DarÃ¼ber hinaus stellte die Studie eine Verbesserung des internen Fachwissens, eine Beschleunigung von Innovationsprozessen und eine Minderung von Systemrisiken fest.

Neben der EinfÃ¼hrung von SAP Preferred Success fÃ¼r zusÃ¤tzliche SAP-LÃ¶sungen und der Erweiterung durch die Expanded Edition fÃ¼r einige der LÃ¶sungen, hat SAP Preferred Success auch sein Serviceportfolio erweitert, um den sich wandelnden BedÃ¼rfnissen der Kunden gerecht zu werden. Dabei ist zu beachten, dass sich die angebotenen Services je nach SAP-LÃ¶sung unterscheiden, um eine mÃ¶glichst passgenaue UnterstÃ¼tzung zu gewÃ¤hrleisten.

Ein besonderer Schwerpunkt liegt auf den neu eingefÃ¼hrten AI Accelerator Services. Diese innovativen Dienste sind darauf ausgerichtet, Unternehmen bei der Nutzung kÃ¼nstlicher Intelligenz in ihren SAP-LÃ¶sungen zu unterstÃ¼tzen und sie auf dem Weg zu einer KI-gestÃ¼tzen, zukunftsorientierten UnternehmensfÃ¼hrung zu begleiten. Obwohl die spezifischen Funktionen je nach SAP-Produkt variieren, verfolgen die AI Accelerator Services generell drei Hauptziele:

  1. Innovation: UnterstÃ¼tzung bei der Entwicklung und Implementierung neuer, KI-gestÃ¼tzter GeschÃ¤ftsmodelle und Prozesse.
  2. Automatisierung: Hilfe bei der Identifizierung und Umsetzung von AutomatisierungsmÃ¶glichkeiten durch KI, um Effizienz und ProduktivitÃ¤t zu steigern.
  3. Prozessoptimierung: Beratung zur Verbesserung bestehender GeschÃ¤ftsablÃ¤ufe durch den Einsatz von KI-Technologien.

Beispielsweise kÃ¶nnten die AI Accelerator Services fÃ¼r SAP S/4HANA Kunden dabei unterstÃ¼tzen, intelligente Vorhersagemodelle fÃ¼r die Bestandsoptimierung zu implementieren. FÃ¼r SAP SuccessFactors-Nutzer kÃ¶nnten sie Hilfestellung bei der EinfÃ¼hrung KI-gestÃ¼tzter Rekrutierungsprozesse bieten.

Eine weitere Sparte neuer SAP Preferred Success Services kommt aus dem Bereich Organizational Change Management (OCM). Um dieses Thema abzudecken, das fÃ¼r die Digital Adoption aus menschlicher Sicht unverzichtbar ist, hat das Digital Change and Adoption Team der SAP zwei Services ausgearbeitet:

  • den Transformation Mindset Insights Service sowie
  • den Operational Change & Adoption Readiness Service.

Beide Services nÃ¤hern sich dem Thema Transformation aus der menschlichen Perspektive, denn der Fakt bleibt: Ohne die Mitarbeiter*innen kann keine Transformation erfolgreich werden.

Der Transformation Mindset Insights Service von SAP hilft Organisationen, ihren Reifegrad in Bezug auf TransformationsfÃ¤higkeit zu verstehen und kontinuierlich zu verbessern.

Der Prozess umfasst:

  • Analyse der sechs Mindset Traits, namentlich Resilienz, Systemisches Denken, Kontinuierliche Entwicklung, Cross-Kollaboration, Offenheit fÃ¼r VerÃ¤nderung und Situative AdaptivitÃ¤t.
  • Datenbasierter Ansatz mit Management-Sicht und Mitarbeiterbefragungen.
  • Workshops zur Erarbeitung einer Roadmap zur Verbesserung des Transformation Mindset Reifegrads.
  • Umsetzung von MaÃŸnahmen in einer mit dem Kunden vereinbarten Aktionsphase.
  • Erneute Erhebung des Reifegrads zur ÃœberprÃ¼fung der EffektivitÃ¤t der MaÃŸnahmen.
  • Kontinuierliche Arbeit am Transformation Mindset

So kÃ¶nnen Organisationen kontinuierlich an ihrem Transformation Mindset arbeiten und das Expertenwissen der SAP bei Bedarf zur UnterstÃ¼tzung heranziehen, um so den neuen Herausforderungen unserer stetig wandelnden Welt einen Schritt vorauszubleiben.

Ein zufriedener Kunde hatte Folgendes zu den Ergebnissen des Transformation Mindset Insights Service zu sagen: â€[Der Service] zeigt genau, was wir im letzten Jahr vermutet hatten. Er fÃ¤ngt die GefÃ¼hle ein, die mir die Leute hinter verschlossenen TÃ¼ren mitgeteilt haben. Diese kann ich dem Management nun anhand realer Daten zeigen. Die Ergebnisse spiegeln unsere Situation sehr gut wider.â€œ

Der Operational Change & Adoption Readiness Service richtet sich derweil hauptsÃ¤chlich an Kunden der Human Capital Management (HCM) Sparte der SAP LÃ¶sungen, welche den Reifegrad ihrer OCM AktivitÃ¤ten verstehen und verbessern mÃ¶chten, bevor sie ihre Transformation beginnen.
SAPs OCM Expert*innen evaluieren in einem datenbasierten Vorgehen bestehende OCM AktivitÃ¤ten und Konzepte der Kunden und erarbeiten basierend auf den Ergebnissen gemeinsam mit den Kunden Verbesserungsempfehlungen fÃ¼r ihre OCM- und Trainingsplanung. So kÃ¶nnen Organisationen auch ohne ein ganzes OCM Engagement sicherstellen, dass sie einen gut informierten und effektiven OCM Ansatz fÃ¼r ihre Transformation verfolgen.

Kunden kÃ¶nnen sich fÃ¼r detaillierte Informationen zu den verfÃ¼gbaren Services fÃ¼r ihre spezifischen SAP-LÃ¶sungen an ihren Customer Success Manager wenden.

Fazit:

SAP Preferred Success entwickelt sich stetig weiter, um den Herausforderungen der digitalen Transformation gerecht zu werden. Mit der Expanded Edition und neuen Services wie den AI Accelerator Services oder Change Management Services unterstreicht SAP sein Ziel, Kunden bei der optimalen Nutzung ihrer SAP-LÃ¶sungen zu unterstÃ¼tzen.

Dabei wird individuell auf KundenbedÃ¼rfnisse eingegangen und die WertschÃ¶pfung aus SAP-Investitionen verbessert. So bleiben Unternehmen fÃ¼r zukÃ¼nftige Anforderungen gut gerÃ¼stet.

Informieren Sie sich auf SAP Preferred Success, werfen Sie einen Blick auf die ausgesuchten Informationen unten, wenden Sie sich an Ihre SAP-Ansprechperson oder nehmen Sie mit uns Kontakt auf.

Ãœbrigens: Am 25. Juni 2025 werden die BLS AG und die Barmer Krankenversicherung im Rahmen unseres SAP Learning & Adoption Forums in Walldorf Ã¼ber ihre Erfahrungen mit den Services von SAP Preferred Success berichten. Nutzen Sie die Gelegenheit, Fragen zu stellen und in lockerer AtmosphÃ¤re den Mehrwert von SAP Preferred Success fÃ¼r Ihre eigene Transformationsreise zu evaluieren. Die Veranstaltung findet hybrid statt. Wir wÃ¼rden uns sehr freuen, Sie vor Ort oder online begrÃ¼ssen zu dÃ¼rfen! Hier geht's zur Anmeldung: Registration

Links auf weitere BlogbreitrÃ¤ge und Artikel zu SAP Preferred Success:

entry.title: To infinity and beyond: AI expands shopping experience with a world of possibilities
entry.content:
During Black Friday and Cyber Monday, consumers are offered limitless choices, similar to the variety of toys available for children. At first, every toy appears to be the same â€“ mass-produced and uniform â€“ but as kids interact with them, each one develops according to the childrenâ€™s imagination and preferences. Comparably, as we prepare for shopping scenarios of 2025, these childhood insights are reflected in how AI systems in proactive customer care evolve based on personalized inputs.

An AI-based approach encourages customized interactions, real-time adaptation, and mitigation of decision uncertainty, as it incorporates predicted answers to issues presented to them. An important element in this shopping dynamic, the coordination between AI tools and custom-made efforts aims to pinpoint a change towards more responsive customer support, especially during major shopping events like Black Friday and Cyber Monday.

Technologies for SAP Holiday Season Readiness Program Expansion

For 2025, the SAP Holiday Season Readiness Program is expanding to support more customers than last year. This expansion is led by a greater integration of Preventive Customer Risk Mitigation (PCRM) and intelligent automation to detect and resolve issues before customer impact. The cross-functional collaboration between Support, Cloud Ops, Engineering, and teams plans to ensure faster action and end-to-end visibility.

The improvements integrated into the program since 2024 include:

  • Joule Conversational AI: Joule now allows end-users and internal teams to query case history, check system health, trigger CURE360 reports, and create proactive casesâ€”all via natural language.
  • Agentic AIs: Specialized AI agents now help with scenario planning, task dispatch, risk identification, mitigation planning, and execution monitoring.
  • Smart Notification & Automation Hub: Real-time alerts and automated task execution for infrastructure and application health.
  • Next-Gen CURE360: Deeper root cause analysis, pattern detection, and smart patrol capabilities.

These new technologies use data analytics to predict and prepare for potential issues during the next holiday season. What-if simulations, which forecast the impact of traffic spikes on infrastructure, and pattern recognition, which identify recurring issues and proactive solutions, are two essential factors for AI-powered predictive and preventive analytics. A real-time dashboard with these functions offers a tailored tool to help teams take proactive steps across all system layers.

Collaborative Efforts

The optimization of e-commerce workflows based on real-time data is one of the industry trends we are adopting to enhance customersâ€™ shopping experience. Agentic AI emerges as a prime mover of these efforts compared to the last peak season. The agentic case resolution and AI framework are intended to resolve matters without human intervention and independently conduct monitoring, task orchestration, and mitigation. Moreover, with the assistance of algorithmic learning, Knowledge Base Articles are created to efficiently address similar issues in the future, for quicker and more accurate support.

In our commitment to upgrade customer support through AI, we've introduced new specialized roles and metrics intended to optimize our processes and measure their effectiveness. Key roles, such as AI-Enabled Support Engineers and Preventive Support Engineers, are projected to apply AI for quick decision-making and risk mitigation, while Knowledge Specialists provide accuracy to our knowledge base. Additionally, metrics like AI Deflection Rate and AI-Assisted Resolution Time will allow us to assess how well AI tools resolve issues independently and improve response times.

With this in mind, we are introducing to handle increased traffic and inquiries during the high shopping period the following additional customer support channels:

  • Conversational AI (Joule): open for internal front office teams for queries, e.g. Mission Critical Center (MCC), Technical Operation Manager and Management team. Supports end-user interactions, triggering backend operations on demand.
  • Real Time Support Channel: Promoting the use of real-time support channel
  • Support community: Open dedicated Support Community to customers in scope
  • Live Situation Room Access: High-impact customers can now observe and interact with the real-time resolution channel.

From Cloud Ops to MCC, different roles are shared among teams involved in the preparation for the shopping events of 2025. With a Suite-First strategy, our expert teams seek to provide technical support on integrated product solutions. CURE360-based proactive actions, as well as scenario planning for Smart Resolve and self-healing mechanisms, are some of the features assembled to heighten capacity and handle more significant volumes in the coming years. Furthermore, AI use to deliver these solutions addresses customer expectations towards an AI-first approach. Much like the metaphor of the large offer of toys for kids, increased AI automation is set to provide a personalized customer experience, one thatâ€™s familiar with usersâ€™ queries, regardless of their initial cross-industries aspect.

The future for Customer Support

Several key measures are planned to analyze the outcomes of the 2025 peak season and further enhance the capabilities of invisible support. First, incident post-mortems will be conducted to thoroughly investigate the root causes of any incidents that may have occurred during the peak season. This analysis will be crucial in identifying areas where proactive prevention could have been more effective, ultimately strengthening the "invisible" nature of support by learning how to avoid similar disruptions in the future.

Secondly, the CURE360 Accuracy Review will be employed to specifically assess the accuracy of risk detection by the CURE360 platform and the effectiveness of proactive case creation. This review will determine how well potential issues were identified before they impacted customers, a core tenet of invisible support. It will also evaluate whether the proactive measures taken successfully prevented customer-facing issues.

Finally, for any issues that were not resolved proactively, a gap analysis will be performed to pinpoint any detection or action gaps. This is vital for enhancing invisible support, as it will highlight where the preventative systems or processes fell short, allowing for targeted improvements to ensure a more seamless and uninterrupted experience for customers in subsequent peak seasons. The insights gained from these analyses will directly inform refinements to the intelligent automation and proactive frameworks like CURE360 and agentic AIs, further embedding the principles of invisible support into SAP's operational readiness. The goal is to learn from the 2025 experience to make future support even more preemptive and less noticeable to the customer.

With Joule, agentic AIs, PCRM, and deep AI integration across the stack, our 2025 Black Friday and Cyber Monday support readiness is envisioned to be smarter, faster, more predictive, and scalable than ever before. At Sapphire 2025, just as children discover new possibilities with their toys, weâ€™ll showcase how SAP is preparing customers for a world of personalized purchase experience in retail events.

A sincere appreciation to Tarun Luthra, Global Head of Technical Support, Industries & Customer Experience, Winston Zhou, Director of Technical Support, Keith Ho, Customer Support Engagement Director, and Bharath Ramamurthy, Vice President of Strategic Initiatives, Customer Support, SAP experts who have contributed to this article.

entry.title: â€œLive Preventative Recommendationsâ€ Application is now live
entry.content:
Our journey began in April 2024 when we initially launched the new â€œPreventative KBAs & Notesâ€ card in SAP for Me (original blog) delivering preventative solutions for SAP S/4HANA Cloud systems via an AI-based solution recommendation service. The card has now transitioned into a fully fledged application and has been repositioned to the â€˜Overviewâ€™ area of the Service & Support dashboard in SAP for Me (Going live April 23rd).

You will continue to get your proactive solutions through the new â€˜Live Preventative Recommendationsâ€™ application for the systems you are interested in but with improved usability, filtering capabilities and a more accurate AI recommendation service. These proactive recommendations will help you minimize disruptions, react immediately, and anticipate and mitigate potential risks for your software solution landscape.

Additional enhancements include:

  • Thumbs Up/Thumbs Down customer feedback loop enables customers to provide direct feedback with one click and assists the AI recommendation service to rank recommended preventative support solutions per customer system.
  • The â€˜Software Productâ€™ is now available for all recommended support solutions, helping customers refine recommendations to the products they are interested in.
  • Our AI recommendation service has been further improved to provide even more targeted solutions to your system/software landscape.
  • Preventative support solutions are clustered by system for easier navigation and refinement of solutions.
  • Integration of â€˜Criticalâ€™ support solutions to our AI service.

Where to find it?

To access the proactive solutions, go to â€˜Services & Supportâ€™ dashboard > â€˜Overviewâ€™ tab > â€˜Live Preventative Recommendationsâ€™ launch card.

If you have previously used the â€˜Preventative KBAs & Notesâ€™ card, your system selection will be transferred to the application.

If it is your first visit, KBAs & notes for your favourite systems are automatically listed, provided you have marked ten or fewer systems as favourites. If you do not have favourites, then you can simply use the filter to select the systems you are interested in.

For your next visit, the card shows available preventative, critical, hot, and trending solutions for the systems that you had previously selected.

Refining your solutions

  • For each system in your list, click the respective column header to sort the list by Number, Title, Type, Category, Software Product, Component or by Alert Date (the point in time when the KBA or note was identified as hot, trending, or preventative).
  • Use the filters Systems, Software Products, Components, Types or use Search to narrow the list of KBAs or notes down to the ones you are most interested in.
  • If your S-user is associated with a company in a global corporation, select one of your subsidiaries from the Customer dropdown.
  • Choose the 3-dot menu, then Export, to down12load the table to a local XLSX file on your computer.

Whatâ€™s next?

  • We will continue to enhance the AI recommender service with new data models to achieve greater relevancy & accuracy of preventative solutions.
  • A key task on our road map is to expand the AI services to cover multiple products (Please note, as of today, the type preventative solutions are only available for SAP S/4HANA Cloud). Critical, hot and trending are applicable for all products.
  • Add further filtering capabilities to help you further refine your solutions.

Related Blogs

  • Unlocking Proactive Solutions: Preventative Content now Live in SAP for Me
  • Expanding Proactive Solutions: Critical Content now Live in SAP for Me
  • Predictive and Preventative Support

entry.title: SAP Concur: How to get Support
entry.content:
Need help with SAP Concur? Let's begin by understanding who you are and your role.



  1. Administrator Support 

If you are an Administrator or an Authorized Support Contact (ASC) responsible for managing, configuring, and overseeing your companyâ€™s SAP Concur system, dedicated support is available to assist you. 

An Authorized Support Contact (ASC) is a designated role assigned to 2-5 individuals within your organization, granting them enhanced access to SAP Concur support and resources. 

How to Access Support: 

  • Technical Assistance: Submit a request through the SAP Concur Support Portal. 
  • Phone Support: Call +1 (855) 895-4815 and select â€œTechnical Supportâ€ (option 4). 
  • Training & Resources: Explore the SAP Concur Training Library for comprehensive guides and multilingual instructional materials. 

2. User Support 

Select this option if you use SAP Concur but do not manage or administer the system. If you do not see â€œAdministratorâ€ on your dashboard, you fall under this category. 
 

Advanced Technical Assistance â€“ User Support Desk (USD) 
 

The User Support Desk (USD) is a premium SAP Concur service that provides first-level technical support. However, not all organizations subscribe to this service, as some prefer to handle support internally. 

To check if your company has USD access: 

  1. Log in to your SAP Concur account. 

  2. Click on the Question mark (?) icon and select â€œContact Supportâ€, or find the option at the bottom of your SAP Concur homepage. 

  3. If your company has USD, you will see the â€œContact Supportâ€ button under the Question mark (?) menu, which will direct you to the User Support Desk Portal. 

  4. In the USD Portal, you can: 
  • Find support phone numbers 
  • Chat with experts 
  • Submit a help ticket for further assistance. 

For those who do not have the option to contact SAP Concur Support, please reach out to your internal support desk for assistance. You can find details about your companyâ€™s SAP Concur administrators in the Company Notes section within your SAP Concur system or through internal documentation and resource portals. 
â€¯ 

For users who do not have the option to contact SAP Concur Support, assistance must be sought through your internal support desk. You can find information about your company's SAP Concur administrators in the Company Notes section within your SAP Concur system or through internal documentation and resource portals. 

If you're unsure where to start, reach out to your direct manager for guidance. In most organizations, the SAP Concur site administrator is part of the Accounting, Finance, HR, Payroll, or IT department. 

For login-related issues, refer to the following resources: 

  • How Do I Sign In to My SAP Concur Profile? 
  • Why Canâ€™t I Sign In to the SAP Concur Tool? 

Product Interest 

Select this option if you are not an SAP Concur customer but would like to learn more about our products. 

You will be redirected to contact our Sales team, where you can fill out a form, and a representative will reach out to you. Additionally, you will find the Sales teamâ€™s contact number for further guidance on SAP Concur solutions. 

General SAP notesï¼š

If you have any questions, please post in theâ€¯Q&A (Question & Answer)â€¯section here:â€¯All Questions in Customer Experience |â€¯SAPâ€¯Communityâ€¯andâ€¯All Questions in Support Services | SAP Communityâ€¯

entry.title: Selective Data Transfer to SAP Cloud ALM: Why It Matters and How to Approach It
entry.content:
Why Selective Data Transfer is Important

  • Avoid Information Overload: Not all historical data is necessary in the new environment. Selective transfer helps ensure that only useful, clean, and current information populates SAP Cloud ALM.
  • Optimize Migration Efforts: Focusing on critical data reduces time, effort, and costs during migration.
  • Stay Compliant: Some industries require traceability and documentation. Selectively transferring key records ensures continued compliance.
  • Leverage New Capabilities: SAP Cloud ALM offers streamlined, cloud-optimized capabilities. Having relevant data aligned to these features ensures maximum value from day one.

 

What Needs to Be Done

To prepare for a successful selective data transfer, organizations need to:

  1. Identify Valuable Data: Determine which solution documentation data is still actively needed.
  2. Clean Up the Solution Manager Environment: Archive or delete obsolete and redundant information to minimize noise.
  3. Define the Transfer Scope: Clearly outline what data sets should move â€” based on business value and future use cases.
  4. Engage with SAP Services: SAP provides tools and guided sessions to help in the evaluation and execution of the transfer.

 

How the Selective Data Transfer to SAP Cloud ALM Works

At a high level, selective data transfer typically follows these steps:

  1. Preparation Phase:
    • Analyze and prioritize data within SAP Solution Manager.
    • Use SAP Readiness Check for SAP Cloud ALM to gain an overview of transferable content.
  2. Scope Definition:
    • Define the transfer content (e.g., process hierarchy, library elements, business processes, documents and test cases).
    • Validate data quality and completeness.
  3. Data Extraction:
    • Use Selective Data Transfer application to pull the selected data from SAP Solution Manager.
  4. Data Mapping:
    • Extracted data is adapted where necessary.
    • This ensures compatibility and readiness for upload.
  5. Data Upload into SAP Cloud ALM:
    • Selected data sets are imported into SAP Cloud ALM.
    • Post-transfer validation ensures everything was migrated successfully.
  6. Post-Migration Activities:
    • Train users on the new environment with the transferred data.

 

Learn More â€“ Expert Guided Implementation (EGI) Sessions

SAP offers Expert Guided Implementation (EGI) sessions designed to assist customers through the Selective Data Transfer process. These interactive sessions, delivered remotely by SAP experts, provide step-by-step guidance.

 

To find upcoming EGI sessions, including dates per region, visit:
ğŸ‘‰SAP Enterprise Support Academy - Expert Guided Implementation Calendar

Don't miss the opportunity to engage early â€” spaces in these sessions are often limited!

 

Conclusion

The Selective Data Transfer from SAP Solution Manager to SAP Cloud ALM is a critical step in future-proofing your SAP landscape. By focusing on what matters most, you can streamline operations, reduce clutter, and make the most of SAPâ€™s latest innovations. Planning early, leveraging SAP's tools and expertise, and engaging in guided sessions are key to a smooth, successful migration.

 

Are you ready to get started on your move to SAP Cloud ALM?

entry.title: SMA Solar relies on SAP Cloud Application Services for greater independence in energy supply
entry.content:
During the IT Online Conference held from January 27-30, 2025 under the theme "S/4HANA Transformation and Innovation with SAP RISE and GROW", Heiko Kehm, Head of IT Order to Cash at SMA Solar Technology AG (SMA), provided valuable insights into his company's digitalization strategy. In a discussion with Maike Rose from the IT Online Magazine, as well as Claudia Johne (Client Delivery Manager) and Patricia Gantert (Business Development Manager), both from SAP, Kehm explained to conference attendees how SMA uses SAP Cloud Application Services to accelerate and simplify its digital transformation.

Before the actual interview, conference attendees were asked to answer two questions. Here are the results:

To prepare for the webinar, the three interviewees each formulated a thesis regarding SAP Cloud Application Services. Maike addressed these theses in her introductory moderation and presented them to the audience.

Heiko Kehm:

Support in application operations through SAP Cloud Application Services helps companies to relieve their employees and focus on the digitalization of their business processes. This enables the full potential of cloud investments to be realized faster and with better results.

Claudia Johne:

SAP Cloud Application Services are designed to provide optimized value for customers. The Application Services Manager ensures that services are delivered efficiently, reliably, and tailored to customer needs.

Patricia Gantert:

What do SAP Cloud Application Services have to do with sports? In a gym, a competent team ensures that the equipment works perfectly, allowing trainees to fully concentrate on their training plan. Similarly, SAP Cloud Application Services focus on flexible and simplified service use, thereby relieving employees within the company.

Background and Company Profile

SMA Solar is a leading provider of photovoltaic system technology and energy solutions based in Niestetal near Kassel. Founded in 1981, the company employs around 4,000 people worldwide and achieved a turnover of approximately â‚¬1.9 billion in 2023.

SMA offers a comprehensive portfolio for all segments of solar power generation, storage, and delivery - from solutions for private households to industrial applications. This includes photovoltaic inverters, storage solutions, charging solutions for e-mobility, and energy management services and apps.

From Digital Vision to SMA Solar's Digital Transformation Journey

A digital future vision was developed as the basis for SMA's digitalization strategy. This vision considers processes, data, applications, technologies, and peopleâ€”both employees and managersâ€”in a holistic cooperation model. The aim is to eliminate departmental and content-related barriers and drive digital transformation forward.

Additionally, important guidelines were set for the company to provide a framework for the path to the digital target vision. These include:

  • Standardization of processes
  • Compatibility in the form of plug-and-play
  • Speed to secure competitiveness, to react flexibly to changes, and to innovate in the market
  • A process-oriented work approach to improve customer satisfaction
  • Strong partnerships to focus on core competencies

The digital target vision, process phases, and key success factors of SMA at a glance:

Since 2015, SMA has been pursuing a consistent cloud-first strategy. Important milestones include:

  • Migration of the SAP landscape to the HANA Enterprise Cloud
  • Introduction of SaaS solutions such as SAP SuccessFactors
  • Implementation of SAP S/4HANA as the digital core from 2018
  • Transition to RISE with SAP in 2022
  • Introduction of Digital Manufacturing in electronic production in 2023

Today, SMA is almost 100% in the cloud and no longer operates its own data centre.

What Exactly Are SAP Cloud Application Services?

This question was explained by expert Claudia Johne. SAP Cloud Application Services offer customers comprehensive support in operating their applications and processes. As an integral part of the global SAP support network, they provide a variety of services. Over 1,500 certified consultants have access to the latest product knowledge. Even during the setup and implementation of SAP solutions, questions often arise about operating the SAP landscape and ensuring the stability of the system landscape. SAP Cloud Application Services also support security or cybersecurity topics, test management, development, or improvement of the SAP stack.

SAP Cloud Application Services support the following areas:

  • Ensuring the stability, reliability, and security of applications, extensions, and integrations
  • Taking over all reactive and proactive operational tasks so that the customer can focus on their core business
  • Faster testing and deployment for quicker introduction of SAP solutions
  • Deployment and operation of new features and technologies

How Does SMA Solar use SAP Cloud Application Services?

SMA has been using SAP Cloud Application Services (formerly Application Management Services) for over 10 years. According to Heiko Kehm, the main reasons for this are:

  • Cost flexibility instead of fixed cost structures
  • Relief of the internal IT team from routine tasks
  • High quality and stability in operations
  • Overall responsibility of SAP for product, operations, and consulting
  • Trustworthy partnership for problem-solving
  • Focus on core competencies and digital innovation

Claudia Johne confirmed these specific benefits mentioned by SMA and added the following characteristics of SAP Cloud Application Services:

  • Comprehensive application management, i.e., support in managing cross-SAP solutions, from SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud to Public Cloud solutions like SAP SuccessFactors or SAP Business Technology Platform.
  • Close cooperation within the internal SAP network.
  • Proactive solution management, e.g., to comply with EU regulations.
  • Extensive language offerings beyond the standard languages of English and German.
  • A central Application Services Manager ensures comprehensive application management, i.e., the customer receives everything from one source.
  • "SAP runs SAP", i.e., SAP also uses the same tools, processes, and best practices within SAP.

Specifically, SMA uses the following packages of SAP Cloud Application Services:

  • Incident, problem, and change management
  • Application operations for SAP S/4HANA operations
  • Application monitoring (interfaces, jobs, certificates)
  • Security management (implementation of security notes)
  • Support for upgrades and migrations

For Which Customers Is the Use of SAP Cloud Application Services Recommended?

To answer this question, Claudia Johne provided some practical use cases where she recommends the use of SAP Cloud Application Services:

  • Customers who do not have in-house support expertise in certain applications or whose employees are long-term tied up in projects can be relieved.
  • Often, customers have guided implementations, i.e., they have engaged SAP or a partner for the implementation phase and are looking for a follow-up model for operating their SAP landscape.
  • In hybrid landscapes, customers may want to focus on their SAP S/4HANA landscape. In this case, SAP Cloud Application Services can support the operation of Public Cloud solutions, for example.
  • When it comes to the strategic development of the system landscape, i.e., the question "Where should it go? What should still be achieved?", the customer is usually on their own. Here, too, SAP Cloud Application Services can help and relieve the company.

How does collaboration around SAP Cloud Application Services work?

According to Heiko Kehm, collaboration in practice is organized through defined roles and regular alignment:

  • Weekly meetings between SMA Service Manager and SAP Application Service Manager
  • Weekly exchange between SMA Inhouse Consulting and SAP Support Team
  • Close coordination with SAP Account Management on contractual and strategic issues

Technically, ticket processing takes place via an interface between the SMA Jira system and the SAP Solution Manager.

From SAP's perspective, Claudia Johne added to the collaboration and her specific role as follows:

The Application Service Manager is the direct point of contact regarding Cloud Application Services. This includes responsibility for delivery performance management, which includes delivery escalation issues or coordination regarding operational and planning activities, for example, if SMA is interested in new Cloud Application Services.

The cooperation model at a glance:

What are the key Success Factors for Digital Transformation?

To conclude the discussion, Maike Rose asked the participants to name one or two key factors for the success of a digital transformation. The factors mentioned included:

  • Focus on innovation and market speed
  • Increasing importance of IT as a key component of the business model
  • Creating innovation spaces through stable operations
  • Early consideration of Cloud Application Services for support
  • Importance of open and cooperative collaboration

Finally, some practical tips from first-hand experience...

  • Analyse which Cloud Application Services make sense for your company
  • Define clear roles and responsibilities in the collaboration
  • Establish regular coordination rounds at operational and strategic levels
  • Use the flexibility to expand or reduce services as needed
  • Actively accompany the change process within the company to create acceptance

Final Thoughts

The use of SAP Cloud Application Services enables SMA Solar to focus on the further development of its core business and digital transformation.

By relieving routine tasks and accessing SAP expertise, the company can implement innovations faster and respond flexibly to market changes. A trustworthy partnership and clear governance structures are decisive success factors.

To conclude the discussion, Maike Rose asked the participants to name one or two key factors for the success of a digital transformation. The factors mentioned included:

  • Focus on innovation and market speed
  • Increasing importance of IT as a key component of the business model
  • Creating innovation spaces through stable operations
  • Early consideration of Cloud Application Services for support

The use of SAP Cloud Application Services enables SMA Solar to focus on the further development of its core business and digital transformation.

By relieving routine tasks and accessing SAP expertise, the company can implement innovations faster and respond flexibly to market changes. A trustworthy partnership and clear governance structures are decisive success factors.

entry.title: How to raise priority of a support case when itâ€™s in Customer Action in SAP for Me
entry.content:
Your support case is in customer action, and you need a guide on how to change the priority? This SAP Blog is for you!

Managing support cases efficiently is crucial, especially if it's in "Customer Action" status. Understanding how to navigate the SAP Support Portal (SAP for Me) can be crucial for timely resolutions and maintaining business continuity.

Before diving into the steps, it's essential to understand what "Customer Action" means. This status indicates that the support case requires input or action from the customer before SAP can proceed with further investigation or resolution. The support team might need more details to proceed with the case. This could include logs, screenshots, or specific error messages, or you may be asked to implement a suggested solution or workaround to see if it resolves the issue, etc.

 

Here's a step-by-step guide on how to change the priority of a support case in SAP for Me when the status is â€œCustomer Actionâ€.

 

  1. Login to SAP for Me using your SAP Universal ID or S-user ID & Password
  2. Under â€œDashboardsâ€, click on â€œServices & Supportâ€.
  3. Click on â€œView Casesâ€.
  4. Open the case from your Case List. 
  5. Click the Edit (pencil icon) beside the Priority. 
  6. In the Priority/Business Impact drop down, select the new priority (e.g. High).
  7. Fill out the required details, e.g. detailed business impact statement, & click on â€œSubmitâ€.
  8. Click on the â€œReplyâ€ button and provide the necessary information. If there are any attachments that need to be included, kindly upload them to the Attachments tab for easy reference (see KBA  How to add an attachment to a support case - SAP for Me.)
  9. Lastly, click on â€œSendâ€ after providing all the required information. 

Note: Before increasing the priority, please refer to KBA: 67739 - Priority of problem cases - SAP for Me to know more about the 4 priority definitions (Low, Medium, High, Very High). Increasing the priority of a support case can be necessary when the issue at hand significantly impacts your business operations or poses a risk to critical processes.

 

Additionally, itâ€™s mandatory that you provide detailed business impact information to speed up the processing of your case. Increasing the priority of a support case in SAP for Me requires clear communication and thorough documentation. See KBA: 1281633 - Speed Up Processing of a Case - SAP for Me. By following these steps, you can ensure that your case receives the attention it needs from SAP.

Remember, the key is to provide SAP with all the necessary information to understand the urgency and impact of the issue.

 

Reminder:

Some Product Areas or Components do not allow High or Very High priority. If you click the Change Priority button, and the dropdown shows only Low or Medium, that means that specific area does not allow the priority to be raised.

For Product/Component areas that do allow a change in priority, you can only change the priority if the case has one of the following statuses:

  • Not Sent to SAP (saved as draft)
  • Customer Action
  • Partner-Customer Action
  • SAP Proposed Solution

It is not possible to change the priority when the case status is any of the following. The Change Priority button will not be displayed.

  • Sent to SAP
  • Sent to SAP Partner
  • In Processing by SAP
  • Confirmed
  • Confirmed Automatically

If needed, contact the Customer Interaction Center (CIC) for assistance and guidance.  KBA: 560499 - Customer Interaction Center: Hotline - Email - Chat

 

Helpful KBAs & Links:

KBA: 2554794- How to update a case that is in Customer Action - SAP for Me

KBA: 1522544 - How to change the priority of a support case - SAP for Me

KBA: 2403394 - How to change support case details - SAP for Me

SAP BLOG: How to Prioritize and Speed Up the Processing of y... - SAP Community

 

Got More Questions?

Please note that the Customer Interaction Center is always happy to guide you on any of the mentioned processes and assist you with any queries you may have!  

Alternatively,â€¯pleaseâ€¯feel free toâ€¯askâ€¯us in the Q&Aâ€¯â€¯All Questions in Customer Experience | SAP Communityâ€¯andâ€¯All Questions in Support Services | SAP Community

 

Don't Miss Out on Free Webcasts

We would like to invite you to our free webcasts, which we believe can help you get the best from your support in SAP. You can find all upcoming webcasts on https://events.sap.com/supportwebcasts/en/home. These sessions are open to all users and will revolve around hot topics in support today such as SAP for Me, Case Management, Universal ID, etc. Additionally, you can explore a range of CIC how-to videos at learning.sap.com. Please feel free to share this information with your colleagues. We are looking forward to your attendance.

 

Lastly, you may want to access all SAP CIC Blogs here:  https://community.sap.com/t5/tag/CustomerInteractionCenter/tg-p/board-id/crm-blog-sap

 

Thanks for reading! We hope you found this guide helpful.

entry.title: Die SAP integrated Toolchain zur Digitalisierung, Modernisierung und End-to-End Transformation
entry.content:
In dieser spannenden Episode des EducationNewscast Podcasts spreche ich mit Florian HofstÃ¤dter Ã¼ber die SAP Integrated Toolchain zur Digitalisierung, Modernisierung und End-to-End-Transformation von SAP-EinfÃ¼hrungen. Florian ist ein erfahrener SAP-Berater mit langjÃ¤hriger Projekterfahrung und teilt wertvolle Einblicke in die praktische Anwendung dieser innovativen Toolchain.

Florian ist ein echtes SAP-GewÃ¤chs - vom Studium Ã¼ber Praktika bis hin zur Master-Thesis war er bereits eng mit SAP verbunden. Nach seinem direkten Einstieg als EWM-Berater entwickelte er sich Ã¼ber fÃ¼nf Jahre in der Beratung weiter und wechselte dann in die Projektleitung und das Programmmanagement. Seit Ã¼ber drei Jahren arbeitet er in diesem Bereich und ist seit dem letzten Jahr intensiv mit der Integrated Toolchain beschÃ¤ftigt, wo er sowohl die interne Awareness bei SAP als auch die Kundenbetreuung vorantreibt. Anbei eine Zusammenfassung als Blog - gern kÃ¶nnt ihr auch reinhÃ¶ren auf SAP Podcasts - Apple Podcasts oder Spotify.

Was ist die SAP Integrated Toolchain?

Die SAP Integrated Toolchain ist eine strategische Kombination aus SAP-eigenen Tools und ausgewÃ¤hlten Partner-Tools. Zu den SAP-Tools gehÃ¶ren LeanIX fÃ¼r Enterprise Architecture Management,  SAP Signavio fÃ¼r Prozessanalyse und -design, Solution Manager und Cloud-ALM fÃ¼r Application Lifecycle Management sowie SAP Enable Now und WalkMe fÃ¼r das Enablement. ErgÃ¤nzt wird diese Sammlung durch Partner-Tools wie Tricentis fÃ¼r Testmanagement und Syniti fÃ¼r Datenmanagement.

Das Besondere an dieser Toolchain ist ihre FlexibilitÃ¤t - du kannst jederzeit damit starten, unabhÃ¤ngig davon, ob du RISE-Kunde bist oder nicht. NatÃ¼rlich bietet RISE-Kunden Vorteile, da LinaX, Signavio und Cloud-ALM bereits Bestandteil des Pakets sind, aber auch ohne RISE kannst du sofort mit der Digitalisierung beginnen.

Toolchain Setup und Architektur

Das Setup der Toolchain ist hochgradig individuell und folgt dem pragmatischen Ansatz "es kommt darauf an". Viele Kunden haben bereits Enterprise-Architecture Ã¼ber LeanIX und Prozesse in Signavio implementiert - diese beiden Bausteine lassen sich hervorragend miteinander verbinden. ZusÃ¤tzlich kann Cloud-ALM positioniert werden, um ein rundes Setup zu schaffen.

Der SchlÃ¼ssel liegt jedoch darin, die konkreten Pain-Points der Kunden zu identifizieren. Wenn ein Kunde beispielsweise hohe AufwÃ¤nde im Testmanagement hat, kann direkt Tricentis platziert werden. Steht ein Kunde am Anfang einer Transformation und mÃ¶chte von alten ECC-Systemen zu S/4HANA wechseln, kommt Syniti ins Spiel.

Tool Walk-Through: Die einzelnen Komponenten

SAP-Tools

LeanIX fungiert als Enterprise Architecture Management Tool, mit dem du deine aktuelle Ist-Architektur abbilden und auch Transformationspfade planen kannst. Du siehst, wo du in sechs Monaten, zwÃ¶lf Monaten oder drei Jahren stehen wirst.

Signavio ist das HerzstÃ¼ck fÃ¼r Prozessanalyse und -design. Hier kannst du Business Process Flows visualisieren, Prozesse analysieren und Optimierungen durchfÃ¼hren.

Cloud-ALM und Solution Manager unterstÃ¼tzen den gesamten Lebenszyklus von Design Ã¼ber Build bis zur Run-Phase. WÃ¤hrend Cloud-ALM strategisch gesetzt ist, bleibt Solution Manager fÃ¼r viele FunktionalitÃ¤ten relevant, die in Cloud-ALM noch nicht verfÃ¼gbar sind.

SAP Enable Now und WalkMe bilden das Enablement-Duo. WalkMe wird sein Branding behalten und bietet In-System-Guidance, wÃ¤hrend Enable Now darin aufgehen wird in einem Werkzeug fÃ¼r digitale Lernmaterialien und Wissensmanagement.

Partner-Tools

Tricentis bringt nicht nur Testmanagement mit, sondern auch Change-Impact-Analysen, die den Aufwand fÃ¼r Test-Cases erheblich reduzieren kann.

Syniti spezialisiert sich auf Datenanalyse von alten ECC-Systemen und ermÃ¶glicht das Mapping von Datenobjekten auf neue SAP S/4HANA-Templates.

Praktische Beispiele und Vorteile der integrierten Toolchain

Die Integrated Toolchain bricht Silos auf und schafft echte Synergien zwischen den Tools. Ein konkretes Beispiel: Wenn du deine Architektur in LeanIX mit den Prozessen in Signavio verbindest, siehst du direkt im Prozess, welche Systeme bald aus der Wartung laufen. Oder wenn du einen Prozess in Signavio Ã¤nderst, wird automatisch eine Benachrichtigung an SAP Enable Now gesendet, damit das Trainingsmaterial aktualisiert wird.

Besonders beeindruckend ist die Integration zwischen Signavio, Cloud-ALM/Solution Manager und Tricentis: Aus dem Prozessfluss kÃ¶nnen automatisiert Test-Cases angelegt werden, die bei ProzessÃ¤nderungen synchronisiert angepasst werden.

Ein Praxisbeispiel verdeutlicht den Nutzen: Ein Kunde hatte einen Quartalszyklus mit 600 Testtagen ohne Testautomatisierung. Nach der Implementierung von Tricentis mit Change-Impact-Analyse und Testautomatisierung konnte dieser Aufwand drastisch reduziert werden, um einen schnelleren Innovationszyklus zu erreichen.

Rolle von KI in der Toolchain

KÃ¼nstliche Intelligenz ist bereits heute in allen Tools der Toolchain integriert. SAP Enable Now bietet On-the-fly-Ãœbersetzungen von Trainings, Signavio kann aus FlieÃŸtext Business-Process-Flows generieren, und Tricentis nutzt KI-Algorithmen fÃ¼r die Change-Impact-Analyse.

Diese KI-FunktionalitÃ¤ten sind nur der Anfang. In Zukunft werden immer mehr AI-Features hinzukommen, die weitere Benefits liefern und wiederholende TÃ¤tigkeiten automatisieren. Das Ziel ist es, dass sich Mitarbeiter auf wichtige Analysen und Kernthemen konzentrieren kÃ¶nnen, anstatt von kleineren, wiederkehrenden Aufgaben aufgehalten zu werden.

Herausforderungen in der Praxis

Die grÃ¶ÃŸte Herausforderung fÃ¼r Kunden ist oft die Frage: "Wo fange ich an?" Digitalisierung erscheint als Riesenwort, das abschreckt. Hier hilft der pragmatische Ansatz: Identifiziere deine Pain-Points, priorisiere sie und starte mit dem wichtigsten Problem.

Die hÃ¤ufigsten Pain-Points sind Prozesse, Testmanagement und Daten. Zunehmend kommt auch Enterprise Architecture Management dazu - die Anzahl der Applications in mittelstÃ¤ndischen Unternehmen ist von 200 (2020) auf 600 (2025) gestiegen.

Change Management und Training

Change Management ist ein extrem wichtiger, aber oft vernachlÃ¤ssigter Aspekt in Projekten. Du kannst das beste Tool zur VerfÃ¼gung stellen, aber wenn Mitarbeiter die letzten zehn Jahre mit ihrem alten System gearbeitet haben, werden sie nicht von heute auf morgen das neue Tool annehmen. Der Change-Prozess muss von Anfang bis Ende begleitet werden.

WalkMe ergÃ¤nzt dabei SAP Enable Now perfekt: WÃ¤hrend Enable Now umfassende Trainings bietet, gibt WalkMe direkt im System Guidance. Der Name ist Programm - "walk me" fÃ¼hrt dich durch Prozesse, die du nicht oft machst. Die Vision ist, dass du spÃ¤ter kein separates Trainingssystem mehr benÃ¶tigst, sondern die Guidance direkt im SAP-System und auch in Non-SAP-Systemen erhÃ¤ltst.

Ausblick in die Zukunft

Die Integrated Toolchain liefert bereits heute echten Mehrwert, aber mit wachsenden KI-Capabilities wird dieser Mehrwert exponentiell steigen. Wiederholende TÃ¤tigkeiten werden zunehmend automatisiert, sodass sich Teams auf strategische Analysen und Kernthemen konzentrieren kÃ¶nnen.

Die Toolchain wird sich kontinuierlich weiterentwickeln, aber der Fokus bleibt pragmatisch: Identifiziere die wichtigsten Pain-Points und gehe diese systematisch an.

Rolle von Partnern

RISE-Transformationspartner sind Ã¼ber die Toolchain informiert und kÃ¶nnen Transformationen bei Kunden gestalten. Dies erÃ¶ffnet Partnern zusÃ¤tzliche Potenziale fÃ¼r ProjektdurchfÃ¼hrungen und erweitert das Ã–kosystem der Digitalisierung.

Unpopular Opinion: Einfach anfangen!

Florians kontroverse Meinung: Kunden sind oft zu zurÃ¼ckhaltend bei der Digitalisierung. Heute funktioniert bereits sehr viel - man muss einfach nur damit anfangen! Anstatt lange zu diskutieren und die Transformation zu verzÃ¶gern, sollten Unternehmen hands-on die Digitalisierung gemeinsam gestalten.

Wichtig dabei: Tools allein reichen nicht. Die Methodik ist genauso entscheidend. Change Management ist Teil der Methodik, und ohne strikte Governance ist auch das beste Tool zum Scheitern verurteilt. Methodik und Tools mÃ¼ssen Hand in Hand gehen.

Inspirierende Aussagen aus dem Podcast

  1. "Man kann jederzeit mit der Digitalisierung anfangen - es gibt keine Voraussetzungen, die einen zurÃ¼ckhalten sollten."

  2. "Wir wollen Silos aufbrechen und zeigen, dass die Verbindung von Tools echte MehrwertschÃ¶pfung schafft."

  3. "Das beste Tool allein bringt nichts, wenn die Menschen nicht bereit sind, es anzunehmen - Change Management ist entscheidend."

  4. "Keep it simple, man lernt nie aus - in jedem Alter und zu jeder Zeit kann man dazulernen."

  5. "Lasst uns nicht Ã¼ber Digitalisierung sprechen, sondern sie hands-on gemeinsam gestalten."

Konkrete Tipps fÃ¼r die Praxis von Florian

  • Starte pragmatisch: Identifiziere deine grÃ¶ÃŸten Pain-Points und priorisiere sie

  • Denke integriert: Nutze die Synergien zwischen den Tools, anstatt sie isoliert zu betrachten

  • Investiere in Change Management: Begleite den Transformationsprozess von Anfang bis Ende

  • Nutze KI-Features: Die AI-FunktionalitÃ¤ten sind bereits heute verfÃ¼gbar und bringen sofortigen Nutzen

  • Baue hybride Landschaften: Du musst nicht alles auf einmal umstellen - kombiniere bestehende und neue Tools sinnvoll

Kurzes ResÃ¼mee

Die SAP Integrated Toolchain ist mehr als nur eine Sammlung von Tools - sie ist ein ganzheitlicher Ansatz zur Digitalisierung von SAP-Projekten und dem Betrieb. Damit kÃ¶nnen viele Effizienzen realisiert werden, was sich schnell bezahlbar macht. Ich habe mich manchmal geefragt, wie SAP Projekte und der kontinulierliche Betrieb weiter digitalisiert werden kÃ¶nnen. Neben der Digitalsierung der eigentlichen WertschÃ¶pfungsprozesse. Und hier ist die Toolchain eine Antwort.

Change Management und die richtige Methodik sind dabei genauso wichtig wie die technischen Capabilities. Mich freut es,  dass die so wichtigen Themen wie Lernen und Change Management dabei auch reflektiert sind. 

Es gibt Ã¼brigens auch 2 Services dazu: Den Integrated Toolchain Discovery & Advisory Service - mehr Infos in den Links unten.     

Postet Eure Fragen oder Kommentare gerne hier unten - freue mich auf eine weitere Diskussion. 

WeiterfÃ¼hrende Links

  • Florian auf LinkedIn

  • Informationen zur Toolchain inkl. zwei Services

  • Instagram Account zum Thema Kommunikation - askvinh

  • EducationNewscast Podcast

entry.title: Boosting your experience with the Customer Interaction Center â€“ Get the best from SAP Support
entry.content:
Navigating SAPâ€™s vast support infrastructure can be overwhelmingâ€”but that is where the Customer Interaction Center (CIC) steps in as your trusted partner. Whether you are a customer, colleague, or partner, the CIC is here to guide you, connect you with the right teams, and ensure your support journey is smooth and effective.                                       

 
But what exactly do they do, and how can you best interact with them? In this blog post, we will dive into the world of the Customer Interaction Center, helping you become familiar and fully aware of their scope and how they can assist you.

As a proud member of this team, I am excited to walk you through how we can help you get the most out of SAP Support. 

 
Let's explore the key focus areas:

The CIC is your first point of contact for non-product related queries. We help you: 

  • Escalate support cases 
  • Manage S-user ID and Universal ID issues 
  • Navigate SAP for Me 
  • Connect with the right SAP teams 

Letâ€™s break down how we support you in each area. 


Support Case Escalation 

 Have you opened a case with SAP technical support and need further assistance? The Customer Interaction Center is your go-to contact.  
 

Our agents will assist you by sharing a status update of your case and taking the relevant actions to expedite its resolution. 

A few points you should keep in mind:  

  • CIC is not part of the technical team, so we cannot provide the product expertsâ€™ advice on your issue.  
  • All requests, including call backs, priority adjustments, and speed-ups, require Business Impact details. This critical information helps prioritize cases.  
  • Ensure Business Impact information is documented in the case or have it ready during your interaction with our agents. 

If you are unsure about the relevant information to share as Business Impact, please refer to these meaningful articles and blog posts with guidance on which details you should consider adding to your case:  

  • What about Business Impact? 
  • SAP Note 1281633 - Speed Up Processing of a Case 
  • SAP Knowledge Base Article 3536459 - Business Impact-Driven Case Prioritization â€“ SAP for Me 
     

S-user ID Support  

Experiencing issues with your S-user ID setup? The Customer Interaction Center is here to help. We can check the status of your ID - whether it is active, expired, or locked - and verify assigned authorizations along with your companyâ€™s customer account information. 

We can also identify your Super Administrator's name and suggest the permissions needed for specific accesses in SAP for Me. Remember that our team covers S-user ID use within SAP for Me and SAP Support Portal. Other applications might require expertise from different support areas. 

 
 
SAP for Me Guidance 

SAP for Me is now the central entry for support at SAP. We at CIC are available as a point for non-technical guidance on best practices for using and navigating this portal. 

 

It is important to highlight that our team provides support on customer-facing dashboards like Services & Support and Users & Contacts.  

 

 


 
Dashboards designed for SAP Partners, please contact SAP Partner Support through your SAP Partner Portal for assistance.  
 
When it comes to issues in SAP for Me, the Customer Interaction Center performs an initial troubleshooting focused on your S-user ID status, authorizations, and customer account setup. In case of any technical concerns or data inconsistency happening in the portal, you might be redirected to create a case with SAP for Me technical team, or to interact with another relevant organization that is responsible for the information maintained in the section affected, such as the SAP Contracts team or your companyâ€™s SAP Account Manager.  

  • Not sure who your companyâ€™s SAP Account Manager is? Connect with us for assistance.  When interacting with our agents, make sure that you are aware of your S-user ID, customer number, and customer name to allow the relevant information to be shared with you.  

    Find more details on SAP Knowledge Base Article 2626344 - Who is the SAP Account Manager/Executive for my company? 
  • What if you need to contact the SAP Order Management (Contracts) team? All you need to do is send your query to them by e-mail at sapcontractcenter@sap.com as referred on SAP Note 1660069 - How to contact SAP Order Management for contract-related questions or issues. 

 
 
Universal ID Assistance 

Lastly, over the past years CICâ€™s focus has increased on supporting SAP Universal ID users.  
 


Whenever you face an issue or need clarification on setting up your SAP Universal ID, you are encouraged to contact our team.  
 
We are the initial level of support for this type of account and are prepared to confirm your SAP Universal ID status and guide you on best practices or next steps for configuration completion. 
 
For technical issues, our agents may collaborate with the SAP Universal ID technical team for further analysis. 

 
 
In summary, remember that the Customer Interaction Center is your bridge to SAPâ€™s technical organization. We are continuously working to improve your experience and provide you with timely and effective support either by resolving your issue, or by pointing you to the most appropriate channel for your query.  
 
Our team is available 24/7 ensuring you are covered with a â€œfollow the sunâ€ support. With experts located in strategic locations around the world, and service provided in over 10 languages, we are committed to meeting your needs promptly and effectively.  
 
Find the Customer Interaction Center official page and contact information on the following link: Contact Customer Interaction Center  

 

Thank you for reading! We hope you found this helpful and would love to hear your thoughts about this blog post. Let us know what you think!
